If you send this message as a mail to someone, what's the best way to title it?

A good subject line for this type of message might be "Sympathy for your loss" or "Condolences on your recent loss". This will let the recipient know that the message is a condolence message and that it is not spam or something that can be ignored.
How about "Our deepest condolences, Mark". Would that be acceptable and natural sounding?

"Our deepest condolences, Mark" would be an appropriate and natural-sounding subject line for a message expressing condolences to someone named Mark who has recently experienced a loss. It clearly communicates the purpose of the message and allows the recipient to quickly identify the content of the email.
